Package tools.io

Interface ExceptionInputStream

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExceptionInputStreamWrapper, MultiZipInputStream
    public interface ExceptionInputStream
    Interface for adding functionality on top of a class extending InputStream.
    This interface adds easy read calls which throw an exception instead of returning -1. This results in cleaner code when one would throw an exception anyways if certain data is expected.
    It also adds an easy conversion function to switch between the this implementation and the java InputStream variant.

      • read

        int read()
  throws java.io.IOException
        Default read function from the InputStream class to read a single byte.
        Returns:
        The read byte, or -1 if no such byte is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O error.
        See Also:
        InputStream.read()

         int off,
         int len)
  throws java.io.IOException
        Default read function from the InputStream class to read into a part of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        b - The array to read data to.
        off - The index to start reading from (inclusive).
        len - The amount of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The read byte, or -1 if no such byte is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O error.
        See Also:

      • available

        int available()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an estimate of the number of bytes that can be read (or skipped over) from this input stream without blocking, which may be 0, or 0 when end of stream is detected.
        Returns:
        An estimate of the number of bytes that can be read (or skipped over) from this input stream without blocking or 0 when it reaches the end of the input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.available()

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • mark

        void mark​(int readLimit)
        Marks the current position in this input stream. A subsequent call to the reset method repositions this stream at the last marked position so that subsequent reads re-read the same bytes.
        Parameters:
        readLimit - The maximum limit of bytes that can be read before the mark position becomes invalid.
        See Also:
        InputStream.mark(int)

      • markSupported

        boolean markSupported()
        Tests if this input stream supports the mark and reset methods. Whether or not mark and reset are supported is an invariant property of a particular input stream instance. The markSupported method of InputStream returns false.
        Returns:
        true if this stream instance supports the mark and reset methods. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        InputStream.markSupported()

      • readAllBytes

        byte[] readAllBytes()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all remaining bytes from the input stream. This method blocks until all remaining bytes have been read and end of stream is detected, or an exception is thrown. This method does not close the input stream.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the bytes read from this input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.readAllBytes()

      • readNBytes

        int readNBytes​(byte[] b,
               int off,
               int len)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the requested number of bytes from the input stream into the given byte array. This method blocks until len bytes of input data have been read, end of stream is detected, or an exception is thrown. The number of bytes actually read, possibly zero, is returned. This method does not close the input stream.
        Parameters:
        b - The byte array into which the data is read
        off - The start offset in b at which the data is written
        len - The maximum number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        The actual number of bytes read into the buffer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.readNBytes(byte[], int, int)

      • readNBytes

        byte[] readNBytes​(int len)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads up to a specified number of bytes from the input stream. This method blocks until the requested number of bytes have been read, end of stream is detected, or an exception is thrown. This method does not close the input stream.
        Parameters:
        len - The maximum number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the bytes read from this input stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.readNBytes(int)

      • reset

        void reset()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Repositions this stream to the position at the time the mark method was last called on this input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.reset()

        long skip​(long n)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Skips over and discards n bytes of data from this input stream.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of bytes to be skipped.
        Returns:
        The actual number of bytes skipped.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        InputStream.skip(long)

      • transferTo

        long transferTo​(java.io.OutputStream out)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes from this input stream and writes the bytes to the given output stream in the order that they are read. On return, this input stream will be at end of stream. This method does not close either stream.
        Parameters:
        out - The output stream, non-null.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes transferred
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • readException

        default byte readException()
                    throws InsufficientDataException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Reads a single byte from the stream.
        Throws an InsufficientDataException if no data is available.
        Returns:
        The read byte.
        Throws:
        InsufficientDataException - If there was no more data available.
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O error.
        See Also:
        read()

        InsufficientDataException - If there was no more data available.

      • readException

        default void readException​(byte[] b,
                           int off,
                           int len)
                    throws InsufficientDataException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Reads a single byte from the stream.
        Throws an InsufficientDataException if not enough data is available.
        Parameters:
        b - The array to read data to.
        off - The index to start reading from (inclusive).
        len - The amount of bytes to read.
        Throws:
        InsufficientDataException - If there was no more data available.
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O error.
        See Also:
        read(byte[], int, int)

      • readException

        default byte[] readException​(int amt)
                      throws InsufficientDataException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Reads amt bytes from the stream.
        Throws an InsufficientDataException if not enough data is available.
        Parameters:
        amt - The amount of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        An array of length amt containing the bytes from the stream.
        Throws:
        InsufficientDataException - If there was no more data available.
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O error.
        See Also:
        readException(byte[])

      • readException

        default byte[] readException​(int amt,
                             int off,
                             int len)
                      throws InsufficientDataException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Reads len bytes from the stream into an array of length amt. starting at index off.
        Throws an InsufficientDataException if not enough data is available.
        Parameters:
        amt - The amount of bytes to read.
        off - The index to start reading from (inclusive).
        len - The amount of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        An array of length amt containing len bytes from the stream, beginning at index off
        Throws:
        InsufficientDataException - If there was no more data available.
        java.io.IOException - If there was an I/O error.
        See Also:
        readException(byte[])

      • toInputStream

        default java.io.InputStream toInputStream()
        Converts this to an InputStream.
        If this is already an input stream, simply return this. Otherwise wrap it into an ExceptionInputStreamWrapper.
        Returns:
        An InputStream reading the bytes from this stream.
